titulo: Cartoons and Caricatures of Seattle Citizens
resumo: "Cartoons and Caricatures of Seattle Citizens" by Frank Calvert et al. is a collection of satirical illustrations and humorous depictions created in the early 20th century. This book showcases a variety of cartoons featuring notable citizens from Seattle, aiming to provide a light-hearted glimpse into the personalities that shaped the city during this vibrant era. Its illustrations reflect the unique character and social fabric of the community, characterized by wit and charm.  The book features a series of caricatures, each accompanied by the name of the portrayed individual, ranging from business leaders and lawyers to city officials and various other prominent figures of Seattle at the time. Through elegant ink sketches, the contributors capture the spirit of the individuals, often emphasizing defining traits or eccentricities that evoke laughter. The work serves not only as an entertainment piece but also as a historical record, portraying how these figures contributed to Seattleâ€™s identity and evolution within the context of their community.
